intro: Caulinia ancistrocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved caulinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Caulinia ancistrocarpa is adapted to arid environments and is typically found in grasslands and shrublands.
